t: Psalm 77
Confidence in a Time of Crisis
For the choir director: according to Jeduthun. Of Asaph. A psalm.
I*pn cry aloud to God, aloud*ln to God, and he will hear me.
I*ln sought the Lord in my day of trouble. My*ln hands were continually lifted up all*ln night long; I*ln refused to be comforted.
I*ln think of God; I groan; I*ln meditate; my spirit becomes weak. Selah*ig
You*pn have kept me from closing my eyes; I*ln am troubled and cannot speak.
I*ln consider days of old, years*ln long past.
At*ln night I remember my music; I*ln meditate in my heart, and my spirit ponders.
“Will*pn the Lord reject forever and*ln never again show favor?
Has*ln his faithful love ceased forever? Is*ln his promise at an end for all generations?
Has*ln God forgotten to be gracious? Has*ln he in anger withheld his compassion?” Selah*ig
So*pn I say, “I am grieved that*ln the right hand of the Most High has changed.”
I*ln will remember the Lord’s*s works; yes,*ln I will remember your ancient wonders.
I*ln will reflect on all you have done and*ln meditate on your actions.
God,*pn your way is holy. What*ln god is great like God?
You*ln are the God who works wonders; you*ln revealed your strength among the peoples.
With*ln power you redeemed your people, the*ln descendants of Jacob and Joseph. Selah*ig
The*pn water saw you, God. The*ln water saw you; it trembled. Even*ln the depths shook.
The*ln clouds poured down water. The*ln storm clouds thundered; your*ln arrows flashed back and forth.
The*ln sound of your thunder was in the whirlwind; lightning*ln lit up the world. The*ln earth shook and quaked.
Your*ln way went through the sea and*ln your path through the vast water, but*ln your footprints were unseen.
You*ln led your people like a flock by*ln the hand of Moses and Aaron.
